title: English Language Arts: Kindergarten
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: IOWA ACADEMIC STANDA RDS FOR English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

5A850553D5EA4041BD66238B3E908725.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to
texts.

5AB2B19855974828809E6E4134318554.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk,
march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

0DF0F4BC58F248B5976474B3CAE10789.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are
colorful).

B35B7D6C39EB497D91DC63B7D86231A6.description:
Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to
their opposites (antonyms).

EC162B574E15447FAFAACFF95F068B4C.description:
Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the
categories represent.

80ECF5C3A76B49F481FB254404CEA077.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

FB746372CE16483084C95F7DEF52D29A.description:
Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less)
as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

10047CB9B9B64CFD990EFCDC991DE35E.description:
Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird
and learning the verb to duck).

1151383E87324AF1B32FBB353A7F3543.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on
kindergarten reading and content.

A60D589977984D54ACE9E0A6F3C93458.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

DA57D84F83A148A39979D67CBF1B3FC3.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

64AA1EFCCAC04E148C1B84F5DA7901F4.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

A5D57B808E084937AAC95EC7C102A648.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

BBD67C61D353484191DC0CD41CB8F04B.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

238C1EC113DA421A80EC86D4382866FD.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

C805F6E57C354BE5A1FF14AE8AD9AC8F.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

3A8593E40EAA4128BC5FFCDC0541F163.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

F38750C566134DC29E29FD31DCB31740.description:
Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly when retelling familiar stories or
reciting poems, nursery rhymes or lines of a play.

642FE7EE6F3D4185911E9F1D8F3CA99F.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

C84A1E18126C4CAEBE4AAE74B831926F.description:
Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional
detail.

25652768947C48C4A9C386EF53A108CE.description:
Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not
understood.

013747478C774638A39D21036AFA8B5A.description:
Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by
asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not
understood.

155CDAACF7184BEDA2D83A79B18F591A.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

74A97BBC2CB54488B7A3BF4F739F3B16.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others, staying on topic, and taking
turns speaking).

23B0EFA8CF474BBD9698570ED9263A3F.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with
peers and adults in both small and larger groups.

9CB74553EB7246BAADD513C955D760AB.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from
provided sources to answer a question.

4FB92CB8AF72435198DBCC709902B5EF.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author
and express opinions about them).

2466C4F6B5564E988E07A15709A84D6C.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

E7ED61648C2E47E3AF7426D6A0BB0D41.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing,
including in collaboration with peers.

A203CDDDE265459B9247533FDEAFB762.description:
With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add
details to strengthen writing as needed.

1A2553BC9DD04C45808715C8A805EAF0.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked
events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what
happened.

D15294FA992644EDAC684F1BF84036F0.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which
they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

90D09C99D9DA422DA0998F096ACC537B.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a
reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference
about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is...).

046BA6B2C92D41FABD347E0D117BC477.description:
Form many upper and lowercase manuscript letters and numerals correctly with proportion, line
awareness, and spacing (between words and letters).

B1FA924C646742F8BE03EF195DE0451C.description: Print with scaffolding and support for a variety of tasks and purposes.

44DA2657B7314B4EA51F7A08169A3459.description: Orally read grade-appropriate text with purpose and understanding.

D67DAD939EB842E5AA85BD071A1CECEB.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

24242359737242B9BE8A86E36C384EC0.description:
Read common high-frequency words with accuracy and automaticity (e.g., the, of, to, you, she,
my, is, are, do, does).

587D076DAB0549649F683040F3F01325.description:
Associate the long and short sounds with common graphemes (spellings) for the five major
vowels.

7850E6168D19436E8901EEC0AE178326.description:
Demonstrate basic knowledge of phoneme-grapheme (one-to-one, letter-sound)
correspondences by producing the primary and most frequent sounds for each consonant.

16E26E4D387140978AADB9C37A034639.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics, which includes word analysis skills to support decoding and
encoding words.

47CD4DE38AD6454CAA04DB58C83E4DC3.description:
Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new
words.

0CE520E9D4AB435DBC9E8033533DF2D2.description:
Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final phonemes (sounds) in three-phoneme
(consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or
/x/.)

973562A71A1F48339691343AED887AAE.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

5013E3FEE42D44178151A8DBA03724FD.description: Count, produce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

67B0AB3CD1174988BFB9D1EF9D5A4339.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and phonemes (sounds).

B2113A4562144E9EAB0D3A58BBA6B69D.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

817E9541A68A403D96833C93D1836FEE.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

32AA042ECDD5410B93B70B04AEAFF65C.description:
Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of
letters.

98781076C5504D779A34473836B2B5BF.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

5B479F5755364578AB2E4B7E9E190494.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

82BB7683A5F545A6AA2BBC1276538630.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

D7510C693C7C435BB4C2D375C38FA5C4.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

761986E6C717461EA43E65F2759E9E61.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BDC26355010E4434B823D834ACA89984.description:
With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same
topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

42D26B7080D7479CA1603750C2315535.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

4E6F0BA0EC1E4195B082BDC552E10B6F.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they
appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

D33C0015D3FF49DB9CDDF023E552C047.description:
Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or
information in a text.

35F4E6FE714A417D9D75FCC8D5E797F5.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

1C4D6F3E8521447887F145958FDABEC4.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words and phrases in a text.

8DDB741A1AE9477D9DBCB7561D49D9D1.description:
With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces
of information in a text.

9A0883F12DF049DC8658F3F49DD1A17F.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

168D14ACC88E4969898A51605D72318C.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

BFC2F960416D49AF9DDB1B5EDF1688D4.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

D52B87F84A9B485A854FF1AA90F23C51.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

72D1A09D1883483DAA7E99EFD268AA63.description:
With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in
familiar stories.

A2FC0E09329347D0B209C4803D5F43C8.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they
appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

271A34712D374027863D26013E14F28A.description:
With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in
telling the story.

3762E0E32D65494189AD128C2FB47A82.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

AA91C4BF62F140D4AAE9F657F0908215.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

5E8CB0935D184E0680502A6FC56190FB.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

752257B5D63A43C3895D8AB4BD9A4362.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

D7994FF811E7403797EC9807FD52F830.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
